dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small waterfall feeds a secluded swimming hole among th Redwoods. Peaceful. Serene. We move over the rocks near the water’s edge until... we come across a thatch of matted, bloody hair. A LIFELESS BODY rests in shallow water near the shore. BLOOD trickles over a WOMAN’S HAND -- a pale strip of ski where her wedding band once rested. cur TO BLACK:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We snap out of the darkness into a new day. A beautiful mountain town in the hills above Santa Cruz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ECU - A brand new running shoe. Youthful FEMALE HANDS ent frame and SNAP the laces tight. cU - A STARTER GUN FIRES. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIX ATHLETIC HIGH SCHOOL GIRLS in the middle of a sprint. KELLIE CALDWELL (17) -- confident, smart and centered bey her years -- quickly pulls ahead of four of the girls. Almost at the front... she trails the WINNER by a hair. SWISH. The winner breaks through the ribbon. Kellie in c succession. APPLAUSE from the stands. Kellie briefly winces at her loss -- then smiles and wave to the crowd. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Time for a picture. Kellie holds a SECOND PLACE MEDAL aloft and wraps an arm around JAMES CALDWELL (early 40’s) -- her handsome, proud father. Posed at their feet is little sister ABBY (8) -- almost t shy to smile. A moment with the happy family... SNAP! TODD (17) -- athletic and kind -- is kept to the sideline Forever stuck in the friend zone. Kellie approaches him and he attempts to hug her. She inadvertently RECOILS but saves the moment with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: (nervous laugh) Come on, I’m all sweaty. She glances at her family to make sure they didn’t see. INT./EXT. JAMES’ CAR - NIGHT Kellie and Abby eat celebratory ice cream as James naviga the winding road. James pulls to a stop at a deserted RED LIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: You killed it out there.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: I guess. It'd be nice to win at some point...

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: You got a trophy, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: So did two other girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm allowed to be proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Are you proud of me too?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Of course I am.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: For bucking the trend.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: It means that I'm proud of how unique you are. You're going to grow up to be something special.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: (lightly teasing) Our special snowflake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pull into the driveway of a nice, semi-secluded hous in the hills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James and the girls are in bed -- Abby in the middle -- t comforter pulled up around them. He grabs the Apple remote.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: What'1ll it be?

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: It's your turn.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: You're the big winner. You decide.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: You never choose. You should get some say around here at some point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: Abby) Frozen?

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: If that's how you want to spend your turn. You'll both be asleep so quick it won't matter.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: That, my young lady, is BS. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James and Abby are fast asleep. The TV illuminates the ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie rinses dishes -- part of her routine -- and places them in the drying rack. Her eyes linger on the soapy water... bubbles swirl acros the surface... We PUSH IN on her face... lost in thought... We see the sink get perilously full then OVERFLOW. Water starts to pool at her feet. She snaps out of it, shuts the sink off and grabs a rag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She covers James with the blanket, picks Abby up and carr her out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEEP! BEEP! BEEP! The motion sensors go off as Kellie carries Abby through the room.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: (quietly) Yeah, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie tucks Abby in. It's SHIVERING COLD. She tries to shut the window over th bed -- but it's stuck. She PUSHES harder... it comes loose. Almost slamming shut before Kellie catches it again... Kellie glances down at Abby. Thankfully still asleep. INT. KELLIE’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Kellie carefully hangs her newest prize on the large TROP SHELF that hangs over her bed. Winning trophies, medals and ribbons from throughout the years are arranged chronologically from left to right. All of them are SECOND or THIRD PLACE. Except for the ver first one -- World's Best Daughter. She gets in bed and pulls up the covers. Satisfied. As soon as she shuts her eyes -- WHISPERS from another ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie enters to find Abby standing in a corner of the room -- whispering at the wall.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Talking...

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Aren't you a little old for imaginary friends? She walks over to Abby, places her hands on her shoulders and steers her back to bed.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: But I'm not tired anymore. Abby lays in bed, letting Kellie pull the covers over her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? You're not scared, are you?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: So why can't you go back to sleep?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Because.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Well, count some sheep or something, alright? It'll make my job easier. Kellie playfully pinches her cheek and gets up to leave. As she reaches the door she glances back at Abby... somew unsettled by all of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs in a pan. Bacon sizzling. Toast POPS out of a toaste Kellie cooks breakfast for three. Been doing it for years Abby shuffles in wearing COWGIRL BOOTS over her tights.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Nope, inappropriate.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Just one of those society things, sis. Go change. James -- wearing a bathrobe -- passes by Abby as he heads the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (to Kellie) Need any help?

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: You don't have time to help. Get dressed. James looks down at his bathrobe and nods -- ‘you're rig He gives her a quick kiss on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: What would I do without you? James turns and heads back to his room -- leaving Kellie beam with pride over her successful morning routine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie and Abby eat breakfast. Playful. Not a care in the world. James, now dressed, sits between them. Nervous about something -- he takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Nothing... I just... I think it's time we talk about --

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Oh no.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Not what. Who. Her. (to James) When?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Next week.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: I like her.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Look, I just want you to be happy.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: But can I just say one thing? And it's about what's right for you, so you can't get mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I reserve the right to get mad, but go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: I'd rather see you with someone... else.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: And now I am a little mad.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Because you don't get a vote now. You get a vote at the beginning, between our third and fourth date. Not a year and a half later.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I just...

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I've played more than fair. I haven't had her over for sleepovers

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: -- that you know of.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Way TMI.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: And now I want her in my life. Our lives, actually. You could use some help around here. You can just be seventeen. Real seventeen, not superhero seventeen. Kellie leans back in her chair, annoyed. This is a battle she cannot win.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: I like superhero seventeen. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The patio of a laid back gastropub. James sits across fro ROBIN (29) -- warm, sunny and ever so slightly "off."

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? The girls love you.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: He smiles Really? I just get this feeling...

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Look, it's a shake-up. But I know it'll be a good one.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: I don't want them to associate me with disruption.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Sometimes disruption is good. I need disruption.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: I know. But I remember that age. Seventeen? She'll have an opinion.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Are you having second thoughts? Because the moving deposit's --

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: No! No. I wanna make it work either way. I'm just thinking out loud. I think I could be a good friend to them, you know? (beat) And a good partner to you.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Wow. and takes her hand. JAMES (cont'd) What a toxic presence you'll be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT on Robin. She stands in front of a mirror -- steeli herself for something.  10. A CRAMPED SPACE containing lots of new-age CERAMIC SCULPTURES and the EQUIPMENT to make them. It looks like we're in her apartment... She braces herself in front of the mirror and takes a cal reassuring breath.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: You can do this. She takes a few steps towards the exit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and steps outside. Revealing the UHAUL in the drivewa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie and Abby sit on the floor -- taking in the progres The family CAT sits between them. The SCULPTURES stick out like a sore thumb in their new environment. Robin kneels down to Kellie and Abby’s eyeline.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: I just want to thank you girls for letting me into your home and your hearts. You know I love your dad and I’m looking forward to being your --

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Sister?

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: I could be a bit of both. A Momster.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Now that has a ring to it.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: You're right. We’ll just vibe it out. Abby notices James removing a single PICTURE from the wal He places it in a box and heads to his room. She follows.  11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James removes a couple of photos from his dresser and add them to the box. Behind him -- an ELECTRICIAN installs a custom CHANDELIER above the bed. Ceramic and glass. Sculpted by Robin.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: It’s a new start, right?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: She doesn’t know you were married?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Of course she does. It’s about making her feel at home. And it’s a new start for me too. Abby pries one of the pictures away from him. Their family as it was five years ago -- James, Kellie (t 12), Abby (then 3) and LEXY (early 30’s). Lexy was luminous. Big eyes that could find a lie anywher

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: I don’t remember her.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Well, there won’t be a test. You were three. James kneels down next to her and looks at the picture. JAMES (cont'd) She loved you very much. (thinks ) We can put this in your room if you want. Would you like that? Abby smiles and nods. Robin enters -- surprised by the chandelier.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Wow. It's up already?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Yep.  12.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Are you sure it... fits?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (lying) Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie roams among the boxes and knick-knacks infecting h house. There’s definitely some annoyance simmering up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin is unpacking DOZENS OF BOOKS and placing them on th shelves. New age stuff. Some YA fiction. Some poetry and eastern religion selections sprinkled in. Kellie reaches for one called ‘The Replacement Mother: Ho Not To Be a Wicked Stepmom.'

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Good stuff. You make it all the way through this one? Robin -- simultaneously gentle and firm -- removes the bo from Kellie’s hands. She knows when she’s being made fun

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Can't blame me for trying.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: (backpedaling) Well you know Abby's kind of weird. If you need any help, you can just ask me. There's no book for her. Robin smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Thanks. That would be great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James -- draped in a bloody apron -- opens up the grill a inspects a delicious looking tri-tip. A bottle of LIGHTER FLUID at his side.  13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin plates the food as Abby sits in her chair giggling talking to... no one.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: (girlish and formal) You'll have to wait. It’s dinner time. Kellie throws a look at Robin -- 'see what I mean?'

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: When did this start?

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Just the other day. (to Abby) Abs. What's the deal?

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: I guess imaginary friends can be healthy.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Not as healthy as real ones.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Meh, let her explore.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry did you just say "meh?" Like, phonetically?

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Is that not how you do it?

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: No, momster. Internet only. You sure you're only twenty-nine?

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Just different interests I guess. Robin's smile fades a bit -- Kellie decides to ease up a little.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Good for you. I'd love to unplug. (beat) Plus it's probably just the generation gap.  14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLOOD oozes out as James carves the tri-tip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The “new” Caldwell family settles in for dinner. Kellie a Abby prepare to dig into their steak. Robin swoops in and sprinkles a bunch of SEEDS on their m right before their forks make contact.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Sesame seeds?

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Hemp seeds.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: So what, am I going to be stoned all night?

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: I run track. They test, you know.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: It won’t show up. (reconsiders) And if it did it’s not like weed ever made anyone faster.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: It’s okay, Kellie.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Its got Omega 3’s. Your dad loves it.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Load me up. Robin sprinkles seeds on his steak as he glares at Kellie ‘give her a break.’

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Actually it just adds a little extra crunch. I like it.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Your brain likes it too.  15. James sets his fork down and raises a glass of wine.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I'd just like to take this opportunity to welcome Robin into our home... (looks into Robin's eyes) «+. and into our family. Everyone CLINKS their glasses. Kellie and Robin exchange nervous looks as they move their glasses in for a toast.. SMASH. Robin's glass shatters in her hand. Everyone at th table startles. JAMES (cont'd) Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Ouch. Blood drips from Robin's hand.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Robin gets up, heads to the sink and washes off the wound

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Yeah, can you just grab me a paper towel? Kellie grabs a roll of paper towels and heads over to Rob BLOOD trickles down Robin's finger into the water in the sink. Oddly similar to the image in the opening scene.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Yikes. Robin rinses the wound. It's tiny. Kellie presses the pap towel into Robin's palm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie flosses and brushes her teeth. All of her movement controlled and efficient. Almost comically precise. A NOISE from inside her room. She turns her head...  16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie steps from her bathroom into the bedroom. WHOOSH. The window opens. She JUMPS back and lets out a gasp. Todd pokes his head through.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, you scared me. (catches her breath) You can't be here right now.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: My Dad's here. Todd finishes climbing through the window.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: He's never here on Tuesdays.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Well, now she's here and that's changed. On Todd -- 'Bummer.'

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: That sucks.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Didn't you see the cars? Todd moves towards her... aiming for seductive, only achieving awkward. She allows a laugh. He leans in for a kiss but she pulls away. KELLIE (cont'd) We’ve talked about this.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Come on, we’ve been dancing around it forever. You know we’re more than friends.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: How’s that?  17.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: I can tell by the way you look at me. He leans in again. TODD (cont'd) They won’t hear anything. They’re probably going at it right now.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: And you think we should do it in sync with them? Ew. She gently pushes him away. KELLIE (cont'd) I don’t want to think of him that way.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: You mean with another woman?

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Instead of your mom.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: No. No one wants to think about their dad doing anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James and Robin are in fact not going at it. His advances have been thwarted by some worrying on Robin's part. A breeze blows in through the open window.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: The seeds were stupid. I should have asked before putting them on.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: It's not a big deal. She liked them.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it's my first night here and I'm messing with her food. Not good.  18. She shakes her head, lost in the past. ROBIN (cont'd) I was never cool in school. Whenever I tried they just hated me more. INT. ABBY’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Abby's half asleep. The window by her bed is once again open -- allowing a gentle breeze into the room. She shivers a bit. Pulls the blanket tighter. Her feet ar still exposed. BRRR. Abby's sheet LIFTS up. At first we think it’s the billowi wind... until it’s PULLED down to cover her feet. A quiet beat. The open window SLAMS shut and the sheets pull TIGHT arou Abby -- literally imprisoning her on the bed. INT. KELLIE’S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS Todd and Kellie hear Abby SCREAM! She heads for the door. Todd follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James and Robin exchange looks and jump out of bed. INT. ABBY’S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS Kellie and Todd run into Abby’s room. Abby’s curled up in ball on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: What happened? James enters the room -- worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin second guesses if she should go into Abby's room or not -- 'I don't want to overstep my bounds.' She sees something MOVING out of the corner of her eye.  19. She turns her head. ‘What's that?' She looks over to Kellie's room... the door is open... a single trophy falls from Kellie's shelf to the ground. She takes a step towards it... but Abby's crying grows louder. She takes a deep breath and heads into Abby's bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin enters and takes her place by James' side. Todd lurks in the background -- almost hoping James won't notice him.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Someone slammed the window!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Sweetie, no one slammed it. James lifts the window. It’s loose. Slides down too easil JAMES (cont'd) It fell. Kellie takes a step towards Abby but Robin beats her to it -- she watches as the new addition comforts her sister JAMES (cont'd) I'll fix it later. It’s too cold to be open anyway. Robin pulls the sheet back onto Abby's bed. James turns and locks eyes with Todd. JAMES (cont'd) And what's he doing here?

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Getting me grounded?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie ushers Todd out front. They shiver in the night ai

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: I don’t know what I was thinking. I just wanted to help.  20.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Your heart was in the right place. Just not your head.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: You really going to be grounded?

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Please. He’s wrapped around my finger.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Pretty soon he'll be wrapped around your stepmom's. He pats her on the shoulder and heads to his car.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: (calling out) She’s not my stepmom!

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Not yet. INT. ABBY’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Kellie enters... Abby is nowhere to be seen. WHISPERS from the closet. Kellie opens the door to find A inside. Abby looks up at her.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: I'm not scared anymore.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Good. Yeah, it was just a loud noise. She takes hold of Abby's hand and gently pulls her up and out of the closet. KELLIE (cont'd) You've really gotta cut that out. She guides Abby back into bed.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: I'm not tired.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: I've heard that before. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KELLIE (cont'd) (sighs) I can lay here for a bit if you want. Kellie crawls into bed with Abby. She notices the family photo on her bedside table. KELLIE (cont'd) Dad give you that? A beat while Abby considers her next thought.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Why doesn’t daddy talk about how she died?

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Well, it’s not fun to talk about. And mommy wasn’t... it wasn’t a good time for daddy and mommy. (switches gears) All you need to know is that she was amazing and she loved you. (beat) Lay on your front and I’1l show you how she used to put me to sleep. Abby lays on her stomach. Kellie places two fingers at th small of her back and gently walks them up her spine. KELLIE (cont'd) (singing) The itsy-bitsy spider went up the water spout... She quickly trails her fingers away from Abby’s neck. KELLIE (cont'd) (singing) Down came the rain and washed the spider out. Out came the sun and dried up all the rain. She walks her fingers back up. KELLIE (cont'd) And the itsy-bitsy spider climbed up the spout again.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Again.  22.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: If you’re anything like I was this'll take a while. (sings) The itsy-bitsy spider went up the water spout... We pan over from the bed to Abby's door... slightly open. EYE watches them from outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin -- in her nightgown -- watches from the darkness of the hallway. Maybe jealous... maybe just wanting to know how to take c of Abby... After a beat she turns and heads back to her bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin soaks in the tub -- a candle lit on the edge of the basin -- trying to unwind. A KNOCK on the door. She startles.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Everything okay in there?

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Yep! Just trying to unwind. (to herself) And hoping this gets easier. TAP. A water drop falls from the shower head above and lands o her forehead. TAP. Robin glances up at the shower head -- annoyed. Another water drop forms then... TAP. The candle FLICKERS as though wind blows over it. Robin looks around... all the windows are closed. TAP. TAP. Robin looks over to THE SINK -- which is now dripping. 'Weird.'  23. She gets out of the tub, puts on her bathrobe and heads t the sink. She twists the faucet OFF. TAP. A DROP of water strikes her forehead. She looks up.. .».. and sees a THIN LINE OF WATER stretching across the ceiling from the shower -- stopping right over her head. TAP. She grabs a towel and blots the water from the ceiling. She looks to the candle... which flickers again before go out completely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Egg whites and spinach in a pan. Turkey bacon in the microwave. Spelt toast POPS out of the toaster. A healthier, more hippy-ish version of the breakfast we s earlier. Kellie practically skips in only to stop in her tracks as she discovers Robin has taken over her duties.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Breakfast?

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: You know, you don't have to do this. I normally get it. Part of my routine.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Oh no, you've got school. You probably have to cram for tests or whatever. It'll be my routine.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: I really think Abby's used to -- Abby -- happily munching away -- looks up from her plate.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: This is good! Kellie sighs, grabs a plate and takes her seat. DING! A laptop on the table chimes. Robin runs over to it and clasps her hands excitedly.  24. ONSCREEN -- Robin’s Etsy page. Her sculptures actually se like crazy.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Sold another one!

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Of those things? Kellie stifles a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: (whispers to Abby) Be nice. Robin grabs a plate of food and joins them at the table.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: (to Abby) You get back to sleep okay after your little adventure?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Yeah. The window didn't fall like dad said, though.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Oh no?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: I was cold so she shut it.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Who shut it?

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: I don't think --

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: I think it was Mom. The air is sucked out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Abby, it wasn't Mom okay? Mom's not here anymore.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m sure she’s here in some way. Robin reaches out with both arms, grabs Kellie and Abby b the hands, and closes her eyes.  25. ROBIN (cont'd) (like she's acknowledging a presence) Lexy, it’s an honor to be in your home with your two beautiful girls. Kellie pulls her hands away.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Are you trying to talk to a ghost? Because ghosts are scary. Even if they're Mom. (to Abby) Which it's not.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Of course not. I was thinking more along the lines of a therapeutic --

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Not talking to walls is therapeutic.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: (to Abby) What makes you think it's her? Why now?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: She’s always been here. I just wasn’t looking for her. sharp in his suit.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: See? Now it's in her head. James enters the kitchen -- already dressed and looking

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (to Robin)

dialogues.speaker: ON KELLIE
dialogues.text: obscuring Will you look at this? I'm running on time for once. -- James gives Robin a quick kiss on the forehead, Kellie's face from the frame as he does so. INT. KELLIE’S BEDROOM - MORNING Kellie’s SKIPPING ROPE. Always training. James KNOCKS on side of her open door.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Hey kiddo.  26.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Hey pops.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Listen, I need you to do me a solid.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: How would you feel about integrating Robin a little more?

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: She’s been here 24 hours and I’m two for two on meals.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I just want her to feel welcome, you know? He gestures to one of Robin's sculptures in the hallway - still wrapped in plastic from the move. JAMES (cont'd) And you could stand to do a little decorating. Her face drops.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Did she ask you to do this?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: No. And it'll play a lot better if it's your idea.

dialogues.speaker: A GARAGE SALE.
dialogues.text: Kellie, Abby and James man a table in the front yard. Box and knick-knacks litter the table. An old VCR, a sculptur of Robin's, a pair of old Rollerblades. No customers so far...

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Why are we selling our stuff?  27.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Well, it's not just our stuff. It's her stuff too. We're both getting rid of what we don't need so everything fits together.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: (rolls her eyes) Yeah, her stuff meshes. A car pulls up. KELLIE (cont'd) I didn't know Grandpa was coming.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I don't want to get rid of anything he'd want. The car door opens and BERNARD (65) -- a swaggering, port curmudgeon -- steps outside.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: Hey there... fam.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES KELLIE
dialogues.text: Hi, Bernard. Hi, Bernard.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Hi, Grandpa! Bernard bends down and gives Abby a hug.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: How's my favorite grandkid? (winks up at Kellie) Just kidding, it's a tie. Robin emerges carrying a big box -- she heads over to the table and sets it down.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Hi! I'm Robin! James stands up -- flustered.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: Hey there, I'm Bernard.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I can't believe you guys haven't met. Robin, Bernard's my father in law.  28. Robin does the math in her head -- 'oh.'

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: It's okay, darlin'. Life goes on. Nice to meet you. Bernard goes off to play with Abby while Robin starts unpacking the box. She pulls out a few DVD's and some books. Then -- she slo pulls out an OLD NECKLACE -- somehow both ornate and tasteful. Robin looks at it curiously. Kellie's eyes widen with ang

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: What are you doing? We can't sell that!

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry. It didn't seem like your style. Kellie takes the necklace from her.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: This was my Mom's.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Oh, Kellie. You know I would never --

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: Everyone simmer down. Bernard wheezes a bit... pulls out an INHALER and takes a puff as he heads over to take a look. BERNARD (cont'd) I don’t remember that one.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Turquoise is a healing stone. (beat) It also keeps people from overreacting.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: Why don't you put it on?

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Oh no, I don't think --  29.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: Come on. If you want it you should wear it. Kellie carefully drapes the necklace over her head... it rests perfectly around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: It looks beautiful on you, Kellie. Robin hands the box she took the necklace from over to Kellie. ROBIN (cont'd) You should really be the one to go through this. Bernard pats Robin on the back and steers her towards the table full of knick-knacks.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: Now let's take a look at the rest of this garbage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie shuts the door behind her. She quickly pulls off the necklace.... places it in her dresser drawer... and closes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lethargic SCIENCE TEACHER lectures. Kellie sits in fron of all the other STUDENTS.

dialogues.speaker: SCIENCE TEACHER
dialogues.text: And what does the law of conservation of energy state? An OVEREAGER STUDENT shoots her hand up. The Science Teac nods in her direction.

dialogues.speaker: OVEREAGER STUDENT
dialogues.text: That energy can neither be created or destroyed. Kellie just stares ahead. Lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: SCIENCE TEACHER
dialogues.text: Very good. What can energy do under this law?  30. Overeager Student shoots her hand up again.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: (blurts out) Change form.

dialogues.speaker: SCIENCE TEACHER
dialogues.text: That's correct. (beat) Although we still raise our hands around here. BZZZ. She reaches into her bag and grabs her cell phone. ON PHONE -- 3 MISSED CALLS and VOICEMAILS from ‘Abby School.’ Kellie raises her hand.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, can I be excused?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie pulls into the elementary school parking lot. She jumps out of her car and RUSHES inside.

dialogues.speaker: ADMINISTRATOR, (0.S. FILTER)
dialogues.text: Hi Kellie, we’re having a bit of a problem with Abby. We were actually wondering if you could come get her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie approaches a SCHOOL ADMINISTRATOR at her desk.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Hi, you guys called. I'm here to get Abby.

dialogues.speaker: ADMINISTRATOR
dialogues.text: She's not here.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: ADMINISTRATOR
dialogues.text: Her mom picked her up.  31.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Okay, her mom is dead. You know that, right?

dialogues.speaker: ADMINISTRATOR
dialogues.text: (whoops ) I'm so sorry. Not her mom. That pretty young lady. Your father added her to the list. She was upsetting the other kids...

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: wh , annoyed) Ly?

dialogues.speaker: ADMINISTRATOR
dialogues.text: She told them she... could talk to the dead. The kids got in her face. Made fun of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie gets into her car -- whips out her phone and dials ‘Dad.’ It goes to voicemail.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES, (0.S. FILTER)
dialogues.text: You’ve reached James. I’m over forty, so feel free to leave a message.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: (into phone) You gave Robin Mom privileges? Isn’t that a little fast? (beat) At least someone’s still doing your job for you. She angrily hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie pulls into the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin and Abby walk down the hall towards her room.  32.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: You know the kids at my school picked on me too.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: They did?

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Big time. I was a little bit different like you are.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: How? Robin takes a long inhale, smiles and kneels down to her.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Us weird ones, we've got to stick together. (beat) Come on, I've got a surprise for you. INT. ABBY’S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS Abby bounds into her room with Robin following. On her be is a WOODEN BOX. She slowly opens it... INSIDE -- PICTURES of Lexy and Abby together. A LOCK OF HAIR.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: I found this stuff during the garage sale. I figure if Kellie gets the necklace... I wanted to save something for you.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: (holding the box) You made this for me?

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: I think it’s important for you to feel a connection with her. And to know that I’m here for you, not to take her place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie quietly sneaks up on Abby's room... peeks through open door.  33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby looks to the closet tentatively... almost as though she's seeking permission from someone we can't see. She nods to whatever she's looking at and then proceeds t give Robin a hug.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Awww. I'm fitting in already? Kellie enters -- her eyes lock on the box.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Is that my mom's stuff?

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: I thought --

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Can you ask before doing things like this please? She's already fixated.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Your dad and I discussed it. Kellie sighs... she'll let this one go. She sits on the b next to Abby.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: She can have it. It's just weird to see this stuff again. I miss her.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Of course you do. Kellie pulls the photo out of the box and gazes at it.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: She was great. (ill-timed glance at Robin) One of a kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James and Robin are post-coital in bed.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: What you did for Abby today was really sweet.  34.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: I just don't want her to think I'm trying to replace this perfect mom. (almost in tears) I already feel like I'm trying to replace a perfect wife.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Who says you're not perfect?

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Part of you has to wish she was still here.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Of course. I loved her very much. But she's not here. You are. And you're not second fiddle. She was my first choice then, but you're my first choice now. (beat) Besides, it's not like things were perfect at the end.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: How? James takes a deep breath. ROBIN (cont'd) If you don't want to talk about it --

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: No, it's okay. She was just distant, you know? Like something was sucking the joy out of her. (beat) I mean, she wasn't wearing her ring when she died.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, James.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: It's not all her fault, you know? I could have done a better job. I was checked out, not involved enough with the kids... (beat) So now I just wonder. About everything. He rolls on his side to face her.  35. JAMES (cont'd) Promise me something, okay?

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Keep me in the loop. Don't let me wonder. INT. KELLIE’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Kellie stares at the moon outside her window. Something catches her attention... A HORRIFYING vision in the corner. Moonlight bears down o it like an evil, black tree growing out of the floor. She flicks on the lights... it’s just that sculpture of Robin's.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Great. INT. ABBY’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Abby lays on her stomach, singing softly to herself.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: (singing) The itsy-bitsy spider went up the water spout... In the background -- her bedroom door slowly CLOSES. ABBY (cont'd) (singing) Down came the rain and washed the spider out... out came the sun and dried up all the rain... A breeze from nowhere waffles the sheets. ABBY (cont'd) (singing) ...and the itsy-bitsy spider climbed up the spout again. Inching closer to sleep, she starts the song again.  36. ABBY (cont'd) (singing) The itsy-bitsy spider climbed up the water spout... INVISIBLE FINGERS walk up her back as she sings along, pressing into her pajamas. ABBY (cont'd) Kellie I didn’t know-- She turns over. No one’s there. She bolts upright in bed looks around. ABBY (cont'd) Kellie? No one's there. A completely empty room. Abby glances at box of Lexy's on her nightstand. ABBY (cont'd) Mommy ? Her eyes lock on something offscreen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We slowly pull away from Abby’s door and into the hallway As we depart... we hear her TALKING. INT. KELLIE’S BEDROOM - NIGHT ANGLE -- Robin’s sculpture. Still downright horrifying in the moonlight. Kellie grabs a blanket and tosses it over the sculpture. Then -- a KNOCKING sound. She scans the room, trying to place it... ...her dresser drawer shakes. Or did she imagine it? She heads to her dresser and opens the drawer. The necklace. She pulls it out and holds it. Fingers the interlocking rivets... concerned... BEEP! BEEP! BEEP! The entry/exit alert from the motion detector system.  37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie investigates -- absentmindedly gripping the neckla

dialogues.speaker: BEEP
dialogues.text: Something stirs at the dark end of the room. She approach slowly... leans down to look... THE CAT JUMPS OUT. She jumps back -- dropping the necklace. At that exact moment a stack of magazines TOPPLES off a nearby table. They fall in the same direction as the necklace. Kellie glances back and forth from the necklace on to the pile of magazines on the floor. She picks up the necklace -- the curtains across the room SWAY UP AND DOWN -- echoing the motion of the necklace as she lifts it... She backs away... frightened... Then... the cat scurries across the room. WHAM! She bumps into James -- scaring the shit out of bot of them.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I was hoping that was you sneaking in or something.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: I’m grounded, remember?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (give me a break) You're never really grounded. James and Kellie check the front door. Locked. He hits a button. The alarm stops. JAMES (cont'd) Motion detector. Abby’s in her room, right? Kellie nods. BEEP! BEEP! BEEP! It goes off again. ‘What the fuck?’  38. Then... the cat SCURRIES into the room. James sighs and flicks the alarm off.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: (wary) He never sets this off.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Yeah, but you've been feeding him too much. (beat) You're not starting to believe this ghost stuff, are you?

dialogues.speaker: I...
dialogues.text: (covering) ... of course not.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Exactly. Team cat. James yawns and pats Kellie on the shoulder. JAMES (cont'd) Going back to bed, kiddo. You should too.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: In a second. She scoops the cat up and heads into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie -- the cat still cradled in one arm -- walks slowl She holds out the necklace and sways it front of her. Nothing. BEEP! BEEP! BEEP! The hallway detector BEHIND her. A chill comes over her -- she looks at the cat cradled against her.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Why couldn’t it be you? She lets the cat fall to the floor and follows as it scurries out of the room.  39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cat runs up to Kellie's door -- PURRING and rubbing against it. A friendly reception for whatever's inside... Kellie slowly approaches her room and reaches for the doo She PULLS her hand away -- it's dripping. The handle is W She opens her door slowly... INT. KELLIE’S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS Kellie scans her room... empty. Still. She glances to the sculpture ... the blanket she threw ov it billows. 'Is something under there?' Her eyes move to the trophy shelf. One small trophy on th end is turned askance. 'Weird.' She slowly stalks toward the display, eyes peeled for anything unusual, and fixes it. Her closet door is open. ‘Fuck.’ She heads over to close PLOP. She spins around to see a trophy on the carpet. She turns back to the closet -- the door SLAMS shut. PLOP. Kellie spins around again. Another trophy on the floor. Kellie doesn’t know what to make of it. They start falling... one by one... PLOP. PLOP. PLOP. Kellie moves to the shelf... then peers down at her hand the necklace TIGHTENS around her palm. Painfully... like noose. BAM! The SHELF TOPPLES over -- sending the trophies and their sharp metal edges down almost all over her. She STUMBLES BACK and FALLS. The necklace slips free, bounces off the floor, slipping under the black recesses of her dresser. She catches a glimpse of herself in the mirror -- SOMETHI is behind her. Undefined, dark... almost wraith-like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrified, she peers into the mirror...

dialogues.speaker: ABBY, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: I told you. It's Mom. Kellie SCREAMS and spins around. Abby stands in the doorw

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: No. Mom wouldn't do this. Mom wouldn't make us feel like this!

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: She did Itsy-Bitsy.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: (whispers, scared) It was watching us...

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Sometimes she whispers things...

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: What does she say? Has she said anything about us? Abby thinks...

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: She asked about the necklace.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Abby, I know I made a big deal about that necklace, but I was just mad at Robin. I was being a jerk. Mom hated that thing. I don’t know who gave it to her and I never saw her wear it. (beat) I need you not to talk to this thing.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Why? I like her. Kellie grabs Abby by the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Abby, I’m your sister. I love you. I would never lie to you. You've got to trust me. Do you trust me?

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Whatever this is... stay away from it. James and Robin arrive to investigate the racket.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (taking in the mess) What the hell happened? Kellie bends down and grabs the WORLDS BEST DAUGHTER trop off the floor.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Robin, can you take Abby back to her room please?

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: (re: the mess) But let me help you-

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Please, Robin. Abby, remember what I said. Robin steers Abby into the hall. James pulls Kellie aside

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Kellie, are you trying to... sabotage this?

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Sabotage what?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: You know... me and Robin.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: (re: the destroyed room) You think I did this? This thing is real. (thinks ) Maybe whatever was “bothering” Mom is now bothering Abby too.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: We both know Mom was acting weird at the end.  42.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: That’s not what happened. She was depressed. James gently takes the WORLD'S BEST DAUGHTER trophy from and places it back on the shelf.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: You don’t believe me do you? James surveys the toppled shelf and the trophies strewn throughout the room -- not knowing what to think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie examines herself in the mirror... there are RED WE on her hand where the necklace tightened around it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie bends down on her hands and knees to peer into the darkness under the dresser. She reaches in... feels around... grappling in the darkness... and finally pulls out the necklace. She studies it... mesmerized. She pulls the blanket off t sculpture, wraps herself up in it and climbs into bed. She gazes up at the necklace for a moment before hiding i under her pillow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family eats -- but everything feels stilted. A nervou energy in the air. The only person not tense is Abby... happily munching away at her breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Maybe it's good that Mom's back. Kellie glares at James -- 'see?'

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Abby, we talked about this.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (to Abby) For right now let's just focus on what we can see.  43.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: But I do see her.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: You're seeing what it wants you to see.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Kellie, you're feeling a lot of upheaval right now and this is the anxiety manifesting itself.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Maybe there is something here, Robin. I honestly don't know.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: I just think everyone's on edge and reading into the wrong things.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: What about my room?

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Maybe the shelf couldn't handle the weight. (smiles) A testament to your hard work.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Do those Dr. Spock books tell you to ignore all danger to your family?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Enough. Whatever's going on, we're still a family. Let's act like it, okay? Kellie grabs her backpack.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Totally. James looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Shoot, we've gotta go too. James scoops Abby out of her seat and heads out of the kitchen. Robin is left alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sighs -- 'what a mess' -- and takes another bite of f and washes it down with some water. ... GULP. Something's caught in her throat -- threatening her gag reflex. She pulls the glass away and notices a SINGLE STRAND OF H hanging from her mouth. Unable to swallow -- she opens her mouth and PULLS the strand out... finally excavating a CLUMP OF MATTED HAIR. Terrified and disgusted -- she closes her eyes and quickl stands up. ... when she opens her eyes she's holding just the single strand again. She looks around... creeped out... 'am I going crazy?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie sits behind the wheel of her car. Todd sits next t her. She’s just told him everything.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: You really think this thing wants to hurt you? She nods. TODD (cont'd) Oh, come on. (off Kellie's look) I didn’t mean it like that. If it’s something you're really feeling...

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: I don’t need sensitive Todd. I need practical Todd. Todd raises his hand.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: So you don’t believe me either?  45.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: I thought you wanted practical Todd.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Actually, I want patient Todd.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Maybe you need a change of scenery. At least next year we'll be a thousand miles away.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Actually... I was thinking of staying here.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: What do you mean? We're going to Boulder.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Not if I go to college in the city.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Why would you stay?

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: My family needs me, okay?

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: They'll be fine. They've got Robin now. Kellie shoots him a look. TODD (cont'd) Got it. Patient Todd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Track practice. Kellie is at the starting line. Up against two students f last time and TWO NEW RUNNERS from the same school. TIGHT ON KELLIE -- her focus is eerily razor sharp. More determined than ever. cu - The starter gun fires. Kellie starts ahead and stays there -- 'Yes! She's finall gonna win!’  46. She gives a quick glance to the STANDS -- and sees A FIGU standing at the top of the bench. ARMS OUTSTRETCHED. COVE BY A RIPPED BODY BAG. DRIPPING WET. Kellie STUMBLES and CRASHES down into the track. Everyone crosses the finish line without her. She looks back up at the stands -- they're empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie’s in class. Tired. Distracted. BLOOD seeps through the bandage on her leg.

dialogues.speaker: SCIENCE TEACHER
dialogues.text: And so what does Newton’s first law tell us? No one raises their hand. The teacher looks to Kellie... she’s off in another world. SCIENCE TEACHER (cont'd) Ms. Caldwell?

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: (snaps out of it) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: SCIENCE TEACHER
dialogues.text: Newton's first law.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: I... I’m sorry. He pats her on the shoulder as he walks down the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: SCIENCE TEACHER
dialogues.text: An object that is at rest will stay at rest until an external force acts upon it. And -- Kellie absentmindedly mouths along with the next part... SCIENCE TEACHER (cont'd) An object in motion will not stop until an external force acts upon it. She glances at her textbook -- a DIAGRAM displaying these principles. An object at rest. An object in motion. An external force. An object stopping.  47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin is on her knees PLANTING SEEDS in the dirt near the deck, a glass of wine at her side.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Got a second? Robin startles. Bernard enters the yard from the side.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Hey, Bernard. What's up?

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: I wanted to clear the air about something since it seems like we're going to be seeing more of each other.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Uh... Sure.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: You've probably guessed that I've steered clear of meeting you these past few years. Robin wipes her hands on her jeans.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Yeah, I thought that might be the case.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: Well, I came to apologize. It's just... at the time I didn’t know what to think of it. (beat) Considering you knew her.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: (flustered) James and I got together three years after the funeral, Bernard. It's a circle of friends. Things happen. Bernard nods -- looks off in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: I came to explain, not accuse. I'm fine with it now. Like I said, life goes on. I was just being a Dad.  48.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Well, I was as surprised as anyone he asked me out. She’s not an easy act to follow.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: Have you told the girls?

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: James and I don't think it's a good idea right now. It's such an uphill battle already.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: Kellie? Robin bends back down and starts digging with her trowel like she’s angry.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Yep. Bernard pulls out his inhaler... takes a puff.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: She's a handful, alright. Likes to be in charge, doesn't she? You gotta fight or roll over with her. Robin pauses on her response as she drops a handful of se into the soil. Then...

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I'm not going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: (chuckles ) Good luck with that. And call me if you need anything. Lord knows James never does.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Anytime. Bernard makes his way back around the side of the yard. Robin pulls out the hose to water the seeds -- notices a LEAK where the tube screws into the water spout. She grabs the spout handle to adjust it -- SPSHHH! It SPR her with water.  49. She steps back -- 'great.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie's car pulls into the driveway as Bernard's pulls o Her eyes trail after him -- 'what's he doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie arrives home and catches a glimpse of Robin throug the back windows. Her eyes linger on Robin -- DRENCHED with water... MATTED hair... INT. KELLIE’S BEDROOM - DAY Kellie closes the door behind her, opens the drawer and pulls out the necklace. She studies it, nervous -- ‘what the fuck am I thinking?’

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie's room is the only one with the lights on. Then... they go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie scouts around. Peering in everyone’s bedroom -- they’re all asleep. She opens a closet and pulls down a SHOEBOX. CU ON SHOEBOX -- Christmas ornaments and tchotchkes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie places a tiny SILVER BELL on her doorknob. She moves down the hall towards the master bedroom and places a silver bell on that doorknob as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie stands on a chair and pulls one of the MOTION DETECTOR SENSORS down. Battery powered. No wires.  50. She repeats this process in the remaining three corners o the room collecting four sensors total.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie places a chair in the center of the room then plan the sensors around it in a circle. A clear enclosed area protection and visibility. She activates the sensors -- BEEP! BEEP! BEEP! -- and sit in the chair. A text arrives on her phone from Todd -- ‘Good luck tonig I believe you.’ Then -- ‘Sure you don’t want company? May the ghost can watch us “leave the friend zone.”' She sighs, tucks the phone in her pocket without answerin then pulls out the necklace and cradles it in her hand. Watches. Waits.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Come on, come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLUNK. The necklace hits the floor. Kellie wakes from an accidental nap. Her eyes dart around... All the cabinets are wide open. 'Weird.' She closes them... unnerved... and thinks for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie quietly exits to the patio and closes the door. Sh shivers from the cool night air. She pulls out her phone. A text from Todd. ‘Still up?’ Sh DIALS and he picks up immediately.

dialogues.speaker: TODD, (0.S. FILTER)
dialogues.text: So. Did it show up again?

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Nothing that’1l convince them they’re in danger.  51.

dialogues.speaker: TODD, (0.S. FILTER)
dialogues.text: What made it appear last time? This sparks a thought. Kellie quickly ends the call.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Let me call you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie pulls some cat treats out of one of the open cabinets...

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Here, kitty kitty. The cat SCURRIES in -- BEEP! BEEP! BEEP! -- and jumps int her lap. The cat warily accepts the treat then turns to leave. Kel GRABS hold of it. It squirms in her lap, trying to get fr The struggle grows. Kellie holds. BEEP! BEEP! BEEP! Something just entered the kitchen! The cat leaps out of her lap with a HISS. Kellie JUMPS TO HER FEET. The cat PURRS at something in the corner of the room. KELLIE (cont'd) (whispers) Leave us alone! BEEP! BEEP! BEEP! It just moved to the other side. Kellie spins in its direction. Still nothing there. BEEP! BEEP! BEEP! Kellie spins again behind her. The thin is moving back and forth. She’s scared. Defiant, Kellie lifts the necklace. Hesitant, a little scared of it. KELLIE (cont'd) (whispers) Here goes nothing. Kellie lights a cigarette lighter and moves the FLAME to section of the necklace.  52. SUDDENLY there is an ungodly SHRIEK -- a wraith-like blac specter appears in front of her. Kellie gapes at the sight. She WINCES in pain -- her hand is burning too -- as if th necklace is resisting with its own unnatural heat. She turns to face the living room -- DROPPING the lighter and necklace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM. Something invisible hits the floor. In pain. We see FINGER MARKS -- five on each hand -- appear in the carpet. They streak down into long lines... like this thi is trying to crawl away in agony. Kellie grabs the necklace and -- with two hands -- pulls with all her might. The chain SNAPS in two. The specter suddenly is sent HURLING forward -- freed by breaking of the chain... but still in agony. Kellie DUCKS as it passes overhead and hugs the ground. The invisible force SLAMS into the BOOKSHELF causing it t wobble and fall forward -- in a split second shot we see cat standing inescapably in its path. The cat -- hair puffed -- stares at Kellie just before th shelf crashes down upon it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie digs a tiny GRAVE -- right where Robin planted her seeds earlier. Tiny sprouted SEEDLINGS speck the dirt. A PAW pokes out of the trash bag next to her. James stands behind Kellie -- oblivious that she's diggin up Robin's stuff.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: How do we explain this to Abby?

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: He ran away? We sent him to a farm where he can play?  53.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I don’t like it. What were you doing up so late? I don’t even understand how this happened.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: I told you how it happened!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (sighs) Your mother loved that cat. Kellie stops digging, stands, faces him.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Dad. Whatever Abby's talking to is real. It's here. It did this. And it is not Mom. It's pretending to be her. (beat) It wants something from Abby. I don't know... to peel her away from us. James gently pries the trowel out of her hand, sticks it the ground, wraps an arm around her and starts walking.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: We need to talk. Kellie looks up at him -- ‘uh oh.' JAMES (cont'd) Look, I'm open to the idea that there's something here. Whether it's your mom or --

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Does part of you wish it was her?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I'd have a few questions I guess.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: People lose rings all the time. Todd's dad lost his three times. It doesn't mean she was --

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: How'd you know about that?

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: I heard you talking about the police report.  She stops 54.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: The point is, it's not your job to fix this. We'll figure it out together. In a way that doesn't send Robin running for the hills. She's only been here a few days, you know?

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Funny. Same timeline as this whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: You don't know her like I do, okay? (beat) You've always been protective of your sister and me. After your mom died, you took on more than any twelve year old should.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: It's fine.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: No, it's not. It wasn't fine. And now I'm grabbing the wheel. walking.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: You're wired to protect us. That’s my fault. I should have been stronger. But now it’s okay to just be you. Alright?

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: So I'm being demoted.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (laughs) No. You're free. We don’t need to be protected.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Well what are you going to do? About this? James smiles halfheartedly and shakes his head as they tu around and head back.  55.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I don't know. We'll figure something out. Kellie looks down as they walk along -- 'no you won't.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin digs through boxes marked ‘Lexy’ in the garage. Wit purpose. Almost frantic. Finally -- she finds what she’s looking for. A WEDDING RI James enters in his bathrobe...

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: What are you up to, sweetie? She swiftly turns and PLUNGES a KITCHEN KNIFE into his chest. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie wakes from her dream SCREAMING. Everyone stares.

dialogues.speaker: SCIENCE TEACHER
dialogues.text: Everything alright, Ms. Caldwell? She gathers her things and bolts for the door.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: (sheepish) I’m really sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd comes running after Kellie as she marches to her car

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Hey! You alright?

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: I’ve gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: I heard you freaked out in class.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: It's nothing.  She slows She stops She turns She shuts 56.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: In sociology they were talking about totems. Some cultures think physical objects can tie spirits to the real world. down.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Yeah? And?

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: The necklace. You said it had some kind of effect on it, right? Like it was hurt? and turns around. TODD (cont'd) I mean it sounds exactly like what they were talking about.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Did they say anything about destroying the spirit?

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: No. This isn’t Hogwarts, Kellie. and heads back to her car. TODD (cont'd) Don’t you think you might be going down a bit of a rabbit hole with the ghosts and the voodoo stuff --

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: It’s not voodoo.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: You know what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: My family needs to know what this thing really is. They don't know what it's capable of. the door, hits the ignition and takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie soaks in the tub. An open bag of EPSOM SALT rests the rim.  57. She pours some into the bath with her. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie steps out of the tub and wraps herself in a towel. She bends down and pulls the PLUG from the tub's drain -- but nothing happens. No bubbles... the water just sits there. Kellie gets on her knees and REACHES into the water... tw of her fingers enter THE DRAIN. We PUSH IN on Kellie's face... cross-cutting with a PUSH on her fingers in the drain... something awful is about t happen... ... but nothing does. Kellie pulls her hand out of the water. The tub remains full. The water sloshing from side to sid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie sits at her desk -- using PLIERS to mash the metal the necklace chain back together. We PUSH IN on the screen of her laptop -- she's been googling Totems. ONSCREEN -- an image of someone holding an object with so kind of force radiating from it -- causing a spirit to writhe in pain. Done with the repair she heads to her bed and lays down - gazing up at the necklace in her hands. Pondering her nex move. Her eyes grow heavy, she tucks the necklace under her pil and settles in for a nap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dusk gives way to night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the shower running. Steam fills the air.  58. We hear the squeak of the knobs as the shower is turned o James emerges and wraps himself in a towel. Without noticing... he walks right past the bathroom mirr as an unnatural condensation APPEARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James crawls into bed with Robin, who is already asleep. As his eyes flutter shut... we hear a soft, raspy sound i the air. Something unnatural. The sound grows louder as we TILT UP to an AIR VENT above

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE -- the AIR VENT in Kellie's room. Emitting the same creepy sound. It's getting louder... Kellie stirs awake. She reaches under her pillow for the necklace... but can't find it. Panicked -- she sits up in bed and lifts up the pillow. T necklace is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James and Robin are fast asleep. ANGLE -- the AIR VENT. The raspy sound grows stronger. At the other end of the room -- behind Robin's SCULPTURES the CURTAINS start BLOWING. The vent going full throttle. One of the sculptures starts to RATTLE and SWAY with the force of the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie rushes over to Abby's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie SHAKES Abby awake.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: What? What is it?  59.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: My necklace. Have you seen it? ANGLE -- the AIR VENT in Abby's room. The sound grows lou still... Abby takes in Kellie's intense glare -- starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: She wanted it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE -- the AIR VENT. The raspy sound now fills the room Robin stirs awake and is immediately terrified. The CHANDELIER sways dangerously overhead. She SHAKES James.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Wake up! Wake up! He bolts up in bed. 'What the fuck is going on?'

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. CLOSE -- the bookshelf across the room. The BOOKS start t RATTLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound is now DEAFENING. Wind blows through their hair

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: (almost yelling) Where is it? We hear Robin SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papers swirl through the air. SCULPTURES shatter. Robin's eyes dart to the chandelier above her and James. Swaying dangerously back and forth. The WALLPAPER bubbles and moves -- suddenly something UNDEFINED emerges -- taking the shape of the wallpaper design. It is then reabsorbed in a FLASH.  60. INT. ABBY’S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS Kellie shakes Abby by the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Where’s the necklace?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chandelier pries loose from its moorings.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Look out! SNAP! The chandelier FALLS. James and Robin jump out of t way as it CRASHES down to the bed. CERAMIC and GLASS SHATTER into a THOUSAND JAGGED FRAGMENT INT. ABBY’S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS Abby scurries over to a SHELF FULL OF DOLLS and pulls the necklace off the neck of an OLDER DOLL hidden in the midd She hands it to Kellie. Kellie PULLS on either side of the necklace. SNAPPING it into two pieces. We hear a SHRIEK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WIND STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: What hell is going on? Terrified -- Robin runs to the bathroom. INT. ABBY’S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS Abby looks past Kellie... A RATTLING inside her closet -- something in there is try to get out. Abby -- sniffling and wiping tears from her cheeks -- get out of bed.  61.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Mommy ? Abby's eyes widen in FEAR. Kellie turns and steps towards her.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: What is it? Abby SCREAMS as she's PULLED across the floor by her ankl into the closet. KELLIE (cont'd) No! Kellie grabs Abby’s wrist but falls back and SLAMS into h bedside table. She gets up and grabs Abby’s wrist again -- but whatever pulling on Abby is too strong. James bursts into the room -- sees the terrifying spectacle -- grabs Abby’s other wrist and PULLS her out o the closet. He scoops her up and carries her out of the room. Kellie looks down at the broken necklace. Slack around he arm. It's gone. For now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin turns on the sink and splashes water on her face. She glances back in the mirror... ...She looks DEAD. PALE with PURPLE BRUISING, WET MATTED HAIR. Swollen. Like she's been face down in the water for two days. The door SHAKES. Robin SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE, (0.S8.)
dialogues.text: It’s me! She looks in the mirror again -- back to normal. ‘What th hell?'

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: I'll be right out.  62.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Are you hurt?

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: I just need a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie, James and Abby sit together in a spot with a good vantage point. James pulls out his cell.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: We need to get you guys out of here. Kellie grabs his hand.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: You need to ask why this is happening now. What's new here? BEHIND THEM -- Robin appears. In shock. Cheeks stained wi tears. KELLIE (cont'd) I'm gonna pack a bag. (to Abby) You're coming with me. I'm not letting you out of my sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellie opens the door and guides Abby -- scared and in shock -- inside. They don't see the SILHOUETTED FIGURE sitting on the bed until... Kellie flicks on the LIGHTS. She JUMPS BACK and gasps for breath... it's just Todd.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Jesus, Todd. Not a good time. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KELLIE (cont'd) (re: terrified Abby) You need to learn how to read the room a little bit, man.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: I found something out... He pulls out his iPhone.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Oh come on I know how to use Google, Todd.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: No no no. I took pictures at the library. Look, a Totem is something that meant a lot to a person while they were alive... ON TODD'S PHONE -- We SWIPE through photos he took of an BOOK -- illustrations of different TOTEMS. All shapes and sizes. Some of them jewelry, some of them not. TODD (cont'd) .».. and now they're bound to it in death. ON TODD'S PHONE -- illustrations of bones being CRUSHED alongside jewelry. A Funeral pyre with onlookers placing Totems upon the flames etc... TODD (cont'd) It has to be touching a piece of the person but... I think maybe we can get rid of this thing. Kellie covers Abby's ears.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Not in front of Abby. It's been a rough night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James opens the door and Bernard steps inside -- looks everyone over. Kellie, Robin and Todd are huddled in the living room. Silent. Everyone is scared... except for Todd.  64.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Thanks for coming. I just need you to take the girls while I clean up and I'll meet you at your place.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: While you clean up?

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: I'm Todd, FYI.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: That's nice. (to James) What the hell is going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernard surveys the damage from the middle of the room wh everyone else watches near the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: Hold on a hot minute now. You guys think a ghost is doing this?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Something like that. Bernard shrugs -- 'okaaaaayyyy.'

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Maybe this is my fault. I mean I encouraged her to talk to it...

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: For once I agree with you.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Kellie, enough!

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: No. Not enough! You saw that thing try to take Abby, right? It's threatening my family. I'm not going to just sit back!

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: (to Kellie) So what’s it doing? Is there any pattern to it?  65.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: (stares at Robin) It followed her here. Maybe it wants to warn us.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: (grits her teeth) Abby thinks it's Lexy. Bernard turns around to face James. Determined. No BS.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Not anymore, now she's scared of it.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: And you saw it too?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I saw something, I think. I don't know what it was.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: And you don't leave immediately? You have me come get the girls while you do... what? (looks James right in the eye) If you thought it wasn't her you would have just driven them over yourself. (beat) If my little girl is here, I want to know. Bernard sits on the bed. Quickly and urgently -- as if staving off a fall. Robin rushes to him.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: You guys can leave if you want. But if there's any chance in hell it's my daughter I'm staying. Kellie looks around. Todd, Robin, James, Bernard... that' it.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: Wait. Where's Abby?  66. Everyone looks around...

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Shit. James peers into the hallway -- she's nowhere to be seen. heads out of the room. JAMES (cont'd) Abby! Kellie turns to Robin.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: See what you've done? James steps back into the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: I know you think it's my fault --

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: It's not just me. Do you really think he’1l want anything to do with you after this?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Kellie, stop! Kellie steps towards Robin.

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
dialogues.text: I mean you knew my Mom but you really liked my Dad. (off Robin's look) You think I didn't know that? You don’t think after this we’re all starting to wonder what you did to take my Mom's place? Bernard glances between Robin and Kellie. KELLIE (cont'd) I don't know why I had my bags ready. The only one who should be packing... is you.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, stop! Let’s just find her!

dialogues.speaker: KELLIE
